collation.signatures: Quire marks in the upper inner corner of the first folium of each quire until . Numeration starts anew with . The quire marks of and are decorated.

layout.ab: Primary pricks and horizontal pricks are visible.
layout.note: Vertical ruled lines mostly stop at the primary pricks, but also go beyond them.
layout.ab: The upper line is written above the ruling, the lower line is written above the ruling.
Primary pricks and horizontal pricks are visible.
layout.note: Vertical ruled lines mostly stop at the primary pricks, but also go beyond them.

layout.ab: The upper line is written above the ruling, the lower line is written above the ruling.

handNote.desc: Written in good hand. and are mentioned as scribes in a supplication on , but no change of hand could be clearly observed.

decoDesc.summary: Numerous miniatures in the , mostly extending over part of a leaf, but occasionally covering the entire leaf.

item.desc: The name of the commissioner was ().
The dates on which the texts are to be read are written in the upper margin of many of the texts.
The note states that the manuscript belongs to the church of .

history.provenance: The manuscript had very probably belonged to a church in the area, from where it was taken by and brought to . It was then looted by the British Napier expedition in 1868.

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.

revisionDesc.change: Continued description from historical catalogue entry with consultation of images
